entry.title: v1.1.0 has been released
entry.content:
v1.1.0 has been released on our GitHub repo. This is the first release since open sourcing Photographer.io last week, and includes a large amount of bugfixes, a reasonable amount of internationalisation, and a small number of new features.

I have decided to aim for a tagged release around every 2 weeks, to give me a target to hit for adding new features and to provide stable points in the application’s history for others to use. There is still a lot to do in relation to documentation, testing, and workflow improvements (such as actually tagging patch releases), but there has been a lot of improvements since the open source announcement.

If you want to get involved then all the code is available on GitHub under an MIT license, or if you fancy translating the app to another language then come join us on Transifex.
